clinical_study.brief_title: Concurrent Chemoradiotherapy(CRT) in Locally Advanced(LA) SCCHN vs Cetuximab With Radiotherapy (RT) After Neoadjuvant Chemotherapy
clinical_study.official_title: Concurrent Chemoradiotherapy in Locally Advanced Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck Versus Concomitant Cetuximab With Radiotherapy After Neoadjuvant Chemotherapy: a Randomized, Opened, Multicenter Phase II Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: Daping Hospital and the Research Institute of Surgery of the Third Military Medical University

clinical_study.source: Daping Hospital and the Research Institute of Surgery of the Third Military Medical University

brief_summary.textblock:
Verify the effect and the incidence of oral mucositis of concurrent chemoradiotherapy in locally advanced squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck versus concomitant cetuximab with radiotherapy after neoadjuvant chemotherapy.
The predictive effect of Apurinic/apyrimidinic endonuclease 1(APE1)/ Ref-1 protein and Apurinic/apyrimidinic endonuclease 1(APE1)/Ref-1 antibody on oral mucositis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall response rate after induction chemotherapy

clinical_study.condition: Carcinoma, Squamous Cell of Head and Neck

arm_group.description: Selected 60 patients with locally advanced squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck.
